page.title: 14T.V.PROGRAMME SUMMARY(1)
page.content: {*}In the early 1980's Anglia Television transmitted a programme about Stisted,"Portrait of a Village". {*}Buildings in the village were the first topic considered.Some are very old,quite a lot new.The most unusual are those designed by Thomas Watts, imported in the 1830's by the then squire,Onley Saville Onley.These incorporated candystick chimneys,each of a different design,over half- timbered structures.Watt's tombstone in All Saints' churchyard features one such minaiture chimney.Stisted Hall, the former manor,is presently a county council Old People's Home.In its grounds is Braintree Golf Club. {*}Cottage industry in the area includes hand-made chocolate and the screen-printing of self-adhesive labels.Michael Rothenstein,a disting- uished printmaker,works in the village
